name: Big Data Tools
description:
With this plugin, you can conveniently work with Zeppelin notebooks,, monitor Spark and Hadoop applications, and preview AWS S3, Google Cloud Storage, Minio, Linode, Digital Open Space, Microsoft Azure, and Hadoop Distributed File System files right from IntelliJ-based IDEs including IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate, PyCharm Professional, and DataGrip.


For Zeppelin notebooks written in Scala, the plugin offers smart navigation, code completion, inspections & quick-fixes, and refactorings inside the notebooks. You can browse, create, and run Zeppelin notebooks without leaving the IDE. If your Zeppelin server is using a Spark cluster, or you configured a Spark cluster separately in the plugin settings, the plugin will allow you to track Spark jobs, see cluster environment and storage information from the IDE. With ZTools, you can view details of the variables as you execute your notebooks, and can get smart completion for data frame columns in SQL and Scala.


You can also upload, download, and preview large structured files in tabular form, including CVS, Parquet, AVRO, and ORC formats.
notes:
Changes in EAP 11

Features:

  • Spark-submit support for IntelliJ IDEA, DataGrip and PyCharm
  • Apache Zeppelin support for DataGrip
  • Editable titles of Zeppelin paragraphs
  • Advanced search filtering in the Spark Monitoring tool
  • Zeppelin text output containing tables is automatically converted into the table view

Usability Problems:

  • Saving and restoring the last saved path for the export feature (charts, tables, and HTML content in Zeppelin note outputs)

Bug fixes:

  • Zeppelin: IDE 2020.1 crashes when displaying Zeppelin note outputs with embedded images
  • Zeppelin: It is not possible to connect to the server if /api/version method requires authentication on the server
  • Zeppelin: Stop Paragraph Action on pending paragraph stops all paragraphs in the notebook
  • Zeppelin: Paragraph numbering in the Structure tool window doesn't match the numbering inside Zeppelin notes
  • Zeppelin: Disable attempts to download sources for the dependencies on every IDEA reopening
  • Zeppelin: Disable "open in the browser" button for local notes
  • Zeppelin: Inlay shouldn't be empty after restarting the interpreter
  • Spark Monitoring: Fix storage JSON parsing to prevent failures when loading Storages the UI
  • Remote FS: Copying a folder inside the Azure container shouldn't clear the files inside that folder
  • Remote FS: Files with an unknown content type should be opened in a text mode
  • Remote FS: Exception when open files without any extension
  • General: Copy and paste files between projects
  • HTTP Proxy: An error appears when connecting to Spark and Hadoop with the enabled socks proxy authorization
  • HTTP Proxy: Error message for invalid proxy authorizations parameters
  • HTTP Proxy: Custom proxy settings shouldn't replace global proxy settings

The full release notes are available here.
